passage_text: 1 Alternately, you can attach it with spray adhesive. 2  Simply spray the stencil material and then carefully place the paper over the top of it. 3  You can also transfer the image to the stencil material using tracing paper. 4  This will work best if the stencil material is cardboard or poster board.

First open your image, you want just the picture you are making into the stencil with no background stuff. I used a picture of Natalie Portman because i know it works well using this technique. 2. You can throw away the background layer after you do this. copy the layer after it has the mask and click the little eye next to the layer to make the top one dissapear and then select the bottom layer. 3.

How to make your own reusable custom stencils. 1. Surf to the image you want and print it off. All stencil images are made to fit on an 8.5x11 page. If you want to enlarge or shrink the image, I have instructions on another page: How to reduce or increase the print size of the stencils. 2. Tape the printed stencil image onto the back of a stencil sheet.

Let's say you found the perfect image and want to make it into a stencil. Well, there are many ways to make a picture into a stencil and it all depends on the image the best way to create a stencil. So, let's explore a couple of options and then don't miss the videos down below.
